origin: Old English weder, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch weer and German Wetter, probably also to the noun wind.

definitions.definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
definitions.example: if the weather's good we can go for a walk

definitions.definition: Wear away or change the appearance or texture of (something) by long exposure to the air.
definitions.example: his skin was weathered almost black by his long outdoor life
the sturdy boat had weathered the storm well

definitions.definition: Make (boards or tiles) overlap downward to keep out rain.
Allow (a hawk) to spend a period perched in the open air.
definitions.example: I would advise to weather her in her hood
